member.summary: Stops the trace replay.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.BlockedProcessesEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the blocked processes monitor is enabled to search for blocked or blocking processes.
member.returns: True if the blocked processes monitor is enabled to search for blocked or blocking processes; otherwise, false (default).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.BlockedProcessesWaitInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold, in seconds, at which blocked process reports are generated.
member.returns: The threshold, in seconds, at which blocked process reports are generated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.DisplayPerfEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an additional event that reports execution time is displayed for each replayed event.
member.returns: True if the additional event is displayed for each replayed event; otherwise,false (default).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.HealthMonitorPollInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between checking for unused threads in seconds.
member.returns: An value that specifies the interval between checking for unused threads in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.HealthMonitorWaitInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum permitted lifetime of an unused thread.
member.returns: An value that specifies the maximum permitted lifetime of an unused thread.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.KeepResults
member.summary: Gets or sets the property value that specifies whether to keep the replay results.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether to keep the results.If True, the results are kept.If False (default), the results are not kept.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the trace replay sequential or synchronized.
member.returns: A object value that specifies the trace mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReplayOptions.NumberOfReplayThreads
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of threads used when replaying the trace.
member.returns: An value that specifies the number of threads used to replay the trace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceServer

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceServer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceServer.InitializeAsReader(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionInfoBase,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the server as a trace reader.
member.param: A object value that specifies the connection information required to establish a connection with the instance of SQL Server that is to be traced.

A value that specifies the path and the name of the file that contains the SQL Server Profiler trace profile. For information about how to create a trace profile manually using SQL Server Profiler, see 6d00378a-5d74-463b-9ed6-a2685306a9d2 SQL Server Profiler Procedures .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceServer.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the trace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceServer.Restart
member.summary: Restarts the trace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceServer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the trace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceTable
member.summary: The class is a Trace object that represents a table of trace information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceTable.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceTable.InitializeAsReader(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionInfoBase,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for reading trace data.
member.param: A object value that specifies the information required to establish a connection with the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that contains the trace table.
A value that specifies the name of the trace table.
A value that specifies the schema to which the trace table belongs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceTable.InitializeAsReplayOutputWriter(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionInfoBase,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for writing replay trace information.
member.param: A object value that specifies the information required to establish a connection with the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that contains the trace table.
A value that specifies the name of the trace table to write the replay trace output data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceTable.InitializeAsWriter(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.TraceReader,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionInfoBase,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the specified object for reading trace data from a object, analyzing the data, and writing data to the referenced trace table.
member.param: A object value that specifies the source of the trace data. This object can represent a trace table or a trace file.
A object value that specifies the information required to establish a connection with the instance of Microsoft SQL Server that contains the trace table.
A value that specifies the name of the trace table to write the replay trace output data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Trace.WriteNotifyEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the handler.
member.param: An value that specifies the source of the event.
A object that contains the event data.
